questions.question: What is the term for a gene located on a sex chromosome?
What is the term for a mutation that involves one or a few nucleotides?
Which law states that allele pairs separate independently during the formation of gametes?
In epistasis, what is the relationship between genes?
options: One gene masks the expression of another gene
Genes are expressed at the same time
Genes interact to produce physical traits
One gene alters the expected outcome of another gene
questions.correct_answer: One gene masks the expression of another gene

questions.question: Which type of RNA is involved in protein synthesis and carries the genetic code from DNA?
Which process produces gametes in animals?
Which scientist(s) is/are associated with the discovery of the structure of DNA?
options: Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel Wallace

questions.question: What is the name of the technique commonly used to amplify a single copy or a few copies of a piece of DNA?
Which of the following statements about telomeres is incorrect?
options: They are found at the ends of chromosomes
They consist of repeated sequences of DNA
They shorten each time a cell divides
They can be lengthened by the action of the enzyme helicase
questions.correct_answer: They can be lengthened by the action of the enzyme helicase
